results.title: How it happened
results.brief_description: Shows common risks and dangers telephone linesmen face resulting generally from negligence of correct safety procedures on their part or that of their fellow workers. A series of sequences provide examples of accidents brought about by one or more of the following basic causes: thoughtlessness, short cuts, poor job planning and arrangement, negligence of safety rules and over-confidence.

results.title: How does a candle burn?
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how the properties of candle wax change as the wax is transformed from a solid to a gaseous state and explores the nature and shape of the flame and the function of the wick.

results.title: How blood clots
results.brief_description: Shows what role each part of the blood playsin the clotting process. Follows the actual generation of platelets from large cells found in the bone marrow.

results.title: How's it going?
results.brief_description: The four cases that make up this film deal with an important management activity: the interview. They have been designed to permit investigation of basic interviewing principles and techniques for appraising employee performance. Specifically, they serve as a springboard for analysing four goals of both interviewer and interviewee: understanding, agreement, action and learning. Methods for dealing with interview problems. The four cases are: 1. More than paperwork. 2. Give and take. 3. Means to an end. 4. The way ahead.

results.title: House of Wax lobby cards
results.brief_description: Reproduction movie lobby card set for the promotio of the film ‘House of Wax’ a Warner Brothers production c1953. The set contains a series of eight colour pinted cards with illustrated scenes from the movie and graphic text noting ‘Natural Vision, Color by Warner Color, 3 Dimension, House of Wax.

results.title: Houdini never died
results.brief_description: Examines the pervasive influence of Houdini on magicans throughout the world. Contains rare footage of Houdini and shows other noted magicans at work. Narrated by Burgess Meredith.

results.title: Hotel New York
results.brief_description: This is the final version of “New York” shown by Jackie Raynal in 1980 as a work-in-progress. It is the story of Loulou Blanchot, a French filmmaker who decides to live in New York after having been invited to show one of her films there. Loulou begins to get acquainted with the city and gets a job as an editor for a porno film company.

results.title: Host
results.brief_description: Lucas states: In this video, I participate in an on-line therapy session directed by the system operator of a streetside multi-media kiosk. As I indulge in a virtual conversation about a troublesome relationship, the session instantly becomes an amalgamation of daytime television and tabloid, wherein the surveillance camera becomes the eye of the media.
